bug.short_desc: qx.ui.menu.Menu of qx.ui.toolbar.MenuButton doesn't appear under testrunner

long_desc.thetext: Whats the reason why they should appear? The test runner is usually a tool for unit testing so viewing the widget should not be necessary. Sometimes it is necessary to add the widgets to the tree and render them but usually it should not be necessary to have access to these widgets.

I guess I missed an important moment. Menu doesn't appear when I click on qx.ui.toolbar.MenuButton. So menu dependent application functionality cannot be tested as well as qx.ui.menu.Menu itself, if it is planned to be covered in qx.test.*.
I can briefly describe my use case as a application regression testing in testrunner. I've ported/improved selenium qooxdoo user extension to native qooxdoo testcase, because I feel selenium for qooxdoo app is much unnecessary overhead and all tools already exist. I plan to do a demo when I complete.
Hm, i still don't get it. Why do you want to click on a menu button during an automated test?

In the case of regression test I don't click anything personally. Simulator clicks via emulating mouse events on widgets to mimic some common application's use cases causing states that test asserts e.g. window is visible, table has n rows, atom labeled "test" exists. It's like general Selenium functionality but specialized for qooxdoo widgets and its hierarchy (http://qooxdoo.org/contrib/project/simulator/selenium-user-extension).
Its what I wrote in second paragraph of prior message, that now regression tests are only available with Selenium plus qooxdoo specific user extension which helps to simulate qooxdoo-specific events and actions. I opt for regression testing right in qooxdoo testrunner without Selenium stack.
Also I don't think its an enhancement because qooxdoo already has UI tests in qx.test.ui.* which render elements in AUT iframe. So this rendering, in general, must be correct, so the case when qx.ui.menu.Menu doesn't appear on click is incorrect.
Getting clearer?

So you are mixing up integration (selenium) tests with unit tests? Is that right?
Anyway, we tried to reproduce the issue in the testrunner and we were able to open the menu and it was displayed at the right spot and everything was as expected. Can you supply a testcase where the error occurs?

Created attachment 747 The example of issue
I've had three steps (under testrunner)
1) added toolbar to app's root - menu appears on click but has incorrect zIndex and items are not focusable 2) added toolbar to window - the same as above 3) added window to desktop - menu doesn't appear

> So you are mixing up integration (selenium) tests with unit tests? Is that right?
What do you mean, mixing? Is testrunner restricted to some specific kind of tests, or why can't I have both in separate namespaces?
I can tell that current project I'm working on, qooxdoo is a frontend of administrative part of application. Public part is common php/zf driven site which is covered (partially) with unit and regression tests. Regression testing is powered by Selenium and controlled by PHPUnit. Selenium stack has its overhead which I know. And I don't feel natural to do regression testing of qooxdoo app with Selenium. So I'm trying to do it in testrunner, considering it a thing which just runs the cases.
